instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air 2018 Doesn't go to sleep when lid closed.
threads.message:
This is not  a liquid dmaged or any damaged board.
Works fine but only issue is it doesnt go to sleep when lid close. 
Sleep wake up works normal way but not with lid closed.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air 2018 Doesn't go to sleep when lid closed.
threads.message: Check lid signals coming from Hall sensors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air 2018 Doesn't go to sleep when lid closed.
threads.message:
Hi 2info this model doesnt have hall sensors. However, there are 2 Lid signals . <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> both are connected to <CHIP>U4850</CHIP>.
Both get 1.5v and firt i thought its wrong. I checked with working board and its same voltage. Anyhow <SIGNAL>LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> cmmunicating with J6100. this could be that singal coming from IO board. is this correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air 2018 Doesn't go to sleep when lid closed.
threads.message:
"this model doesnt have hall sensors"
Really, how do you think lid signals are controlled???
Hall sensors are not placed on MLB, like older boards.

1.5V is good level, as both signals are pulled-up to <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> must have the same level.

Try an USB macOS and check if the problem persist.
You can try first PRAM reset 2-3 times, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air 2018 Doesn't go to sleep when lid closed.
threads.message: Hi, 2info, My  Apologies. Found right sensor on audio board. Audio board was liquid damaged. replaced the audio board. Solved. Hope this will help to other technicians. Thank you very much for your support.
